main event: Two luminous white objects, the size of a half-dollar at arm's length, were observed south of Portland, Oregon on July 6, 1960.
interesting points: The objects appeared to change in elevation, position, and formation, with one object slowly rising above the other.
The objects were visible for at least 45 seconds, passing from south to north directly overhead and curving slowly to the northwest.
The witness, a 45-year-old railroad representative, was considered a reliable observer.
The weather conditions were clear with excellent visibility.
No other evidence, such as photographs or radar, was reported.
